section.p: In a worksheet, you can find in the last two columns the number of visited club meetings in 2009 and 2010. Create using pivot tables in the next reports:

ol.li: The number of members of the club by domicile and by gender.
The percentage of members by hobby and by gender.
An overview of the presence in 2010 by gender, with the number of visited club meetings divided into three groups as shown in the following figure:
The number of members by domicile and by gender
The percentage of members by hobby and by gender
Create a pivot table with Column Labels gender, Row Labels domicile, and Values name (Count). Report Layout: Outline form and without field captions.

Create a pivot table with Column Labels gender, Row Labels hobby, and Values name (Count). Choose tab Options Field Settings (group Active Field) tab Show Values As % of Grand Total . Number format in Percentage with 0 decimals. Report Layout: Outline form without field captions.

Create a pivot table with Column Labels gender, Row Labels 2010, and Values 2010 (Count). Select a number under Row Labels and choose tab Options Group Field (group Group) and start the grouping with 20, end with 49 with increments of 10. Report Layout: Outline form without field captions.
